name: src/ESComplex.js
ESComplex
description:
Next generation code complexity reporting for Javascript abstract syntax trees (AST). ESComplex exposes all methods
available via ESComplexModule & ESComplexProject modules which process AST. Several methods available below accept
source code which is translated via Babylon w/ all plugins enabled allowing any ES6/ES7/edge JS to be parsed.
Asynchronous versions with the `Async` suffix of all methods are available as well.

params.name: options
params.description:
module and project options including user plugins to load including:

(object)             module - Provides an object hash of the following options for the module runtime:
   (boolean)         loadDefaultPlugins - When false ESComplexProject will not load any default plugins.
   (Array<Object>)   plugins - A list of ESComplexModule plugins that have already been instantiated.

(object)             project - Provides an object hash of the following options for the project runtime:
   (boolean)         loadDefaultPlugins - When false ESComplexProject will not load any default plugins.
   (Array<Object>)   plugins - A list of ESComplexProject plugins that have already been instantiated.
params.descriptionRaw:
module and project options including user plugins to load including:
```
(object)             module - Provides an object hash of the following options for the module runtime:
   (boolean)         loadDefaultPlugins - When false ESComplexProject will not load any default plugins.
   (Array<Object>)   plugins - A list of ESComplexModule plugins that have already been instantiated.

(object)             project - Provides an object hash of the following options for the project runtime:
   (boolean)         loadDefaultPlugins - When false ESComplexProject will not load any default plugins.
   (Array<Object>)   plugins - A list of ESComplexProject plugins that have already been instantiated.
```

name: analyzeModule
description: Parses the given source code then processes the generated AST and calculates metrics via plugins.

name: analyzeModuleAST
description: Processes the given ast and calculates metrics via plugins.

name: analyzeProject
description: Processes the given sources and calculates project metrics via plugins.

unknown.tagValue: {{reports: Array<{}>}} - An object hash with a `reports` entry that is an Array of module results.

params.name: sources
params.description: Array of object hashes containing code and srcPath entries with optional entries include filePath and srcPathAlias.
params.descriptionRaw:
Array of object hashes containing `code` and `srcPath` entries with optional
                                  entries include `filePath` and `srcPathAlias`.

return.description: An object hash with a reports entry that is an Array of module results.
return.descriptionRaw: An object hash with a `reports` entry that is an Array of module results.

name: analyzeProjectAST
description: Processes the given modules and calculates project metrics via plugins.

unknown.tagValue: {{reports: Array<{}>}} - An object hash with a `reports` entry that is an Array of module results.

params.name: modules
params.description: Array of object hashes containing ast and srcPath entries with optional entries include filePath and srcPathAlias.
params.descriptionRaw:
Array of object hashes containing `ast` and `srcPath` entries with optional
                                  entries include `filePath` and `srcPathAlias`.

return.description: An object hash with a reports entry that is an Array of module results.
return.descriptionRaw: An object hash with a `reports` entry that is an Array of module results.

description: Provides a convenience method to parse the given source code and return the babylon AST.

description: Processes existing project results and calculates metrics via plugins.

name: src/Parser.js
s_ESM_REGEX
description: Provides a comprehensive regex test to determine if source code is an ES Module.

name: s_BABYLON_OPTIONS
description: Default babylon options applying all available plugins.

name: Parser
description:
Provides a convenience wrapper around babylon applying an ES Modules regex test to automatically set `sourceType`
to `script` or `module`.

name: parse
description: Parses the given source with babylon.

name: src/index.js

export default new ESComplex();
